Abstract: Q&A on practical aspects related to the implementation of the gradual roll-out of Eudamed pursuant to the MDR and IVDR, as amended by Regulation (EU) 2024/1860  amending Regulations (EU) 2017/745 and (EU) 2017/746 as regards a gradual roll-out of Eudamed, the obligation to inform in case of interruption or discontinuation of supply, and transitional provisions for certain in vitro diagnostic medical devices

Title of Standard: Q&A Obligation to inform in case of interruption or discontinuation of supply
Abstract: Q&A Obligation to inform in case of interruption or discontinuation of supply Article 10a of the MDR/IVDR, effective from January 10, 2025, mandates manufacturers to inform about anticipated interruptions or discontinuations of certain medical devices and in vitro diagnostic devices Scope and Responsibility: The obligation applies to all manufacturers, whether inside or outside the EU, and covers devices that could cause serious harm if their supply is interrupted2. Notification Process: Manufacturers must notify economic operators, health institutions, and competent authorities at least six months in advance, unless exceptional circumstances prevent this. Assessment Criteria: Manufacturers must assess and specify reasons for supply interruptions or discontinuations, considering potential serious harm to patients or public health.
